comment: You already tried that and failed. Why do you keep persisting with failed policies? Insanity is doing the same thing over and over again, expecting a different result.
amr:
# ::snt You already tried that and failed. Why do you keep persisting with failed policies? Insanity is doing the same thing over and over again, expecting a different result.
(m / multi-sentence
      :snt1 (a / and
            :op1 (t / try-01
                  :ARG0 (y / you)
                  :ARG1 (t2 / that)
                  :time (a2 / already))
            :op2 (f / fail-01
                  :ARG1 y
                  :ARG2 t2))
      :snt2 (k / keep-02
            :ARG0 (y2 / you)
            :ARG1 (p / persist-01
                  :ARG0 y2
                  :ARG1 (p2 / policy-01
                        :ARG1-of f)))
      :ARG1-of (c / cause-01
            :ARG0 (a3 / amr-unknown))
      :snt3 (d / do-02
            :ARG0 (ii / insanity)
            :ARG1 (t3 / thing
                  :ARG1-of (s / same-01))
            :frequency (o / over-and-over)
            :manner (e / expect-01
                  :ARG0 ii
                  :ARG1 t3
                  :ARG1-of (d2 / differ-02)
                  :ARG2-of (r / result-01))))

comment: Refrain from using hateful racial slurs when posting on this feed.

comment: I don't think using words that perpetuate a negative stereotype show care or promote understanding.
amr:

      :ARG1 (o / or

                        :ARG1 (w / word
                              :ARG0-of (p / perpetuate-01
                                    :ARG1 (s2 / stereotype-01
                                          :ARG0-of (n / negative-02)))))
                  :ARG1 (c / care-01))
            :op2 (p2 / promote-01
                  :ARG0 u
                  :ARG1 (u2 / understand-01))))

comment: Just because someone is a different religion or race doesn't mean they are less than you.
amr:

                  :op2 (r2 / race)))
